brand.name: ground
brand.headline: Order your finances, ground your spending, grow your dreams.
brand.subline: Budgets, spending, and net worth in one place. No spreadsheets, no stress.

login.title: Sign in to ground
login.subtitle: Use your email and password to continue.
login.passwordResetDone: Your password has been updated. You can sign in with your new password.
login.forgotSubtitle: Enter your email and we'll send you a code to reset your password.
login.resetSubtitle: Enter the code we sent to <1>{{email}}</1> and your new password.
login.resetEmailNote: The email may take a few minutes to arrive. Check your spam folder if you don't see it.
login.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters

register.title: Create your account
register.requestSubtitle: Enter your email and we'll send you a verification code.
register.verifySubtitle: The email may take a few minutes to arrive. Check your spam folder if you don't see it.

sidebar.displayCurrencyTooltip: Display currency for panels (totals, summaries, charts)

common.mobileWarningMessage: ground's current experience was designed for desktop. On mobile you can only view the dashboard and create expenses. To access all features, use a desktop computer.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Monthly snapshot & annual projection (USD)
dashboard.step5Desc: Review your monthly snapshot and annual projection. If everything looks right, finish the setup.
dashboard.noCategories: No categories with spending this month. Add expenses in <1>Expenses</1> to see a breakdown.
dashboard.noExpensesThisMonth: No expenses this month. Add or confirm drafts in <1>Expenses</1>.
dashboard.pieNoData: No spending by category this month.

expenses.title: Expenses
expenses.subtitle: Create real expenses + confirm template drafts (Base: USD)
expenses.subtitlePrefix: Create real expenses + confirm template drafts
expenses.step2Desc: Drafts are generated from your Templates. Review them for <1>{{month}}</1>, edit if needed, and confirm to create real expenses.
expenses.step2Tip: Tip: If you don't see drafts, go back to Admin → Templates and create your base template.
expenses.noExpensesYet: No expenses yet for this month. Add one below or confirm drafts from Admin → Templates.
expenses.addExpenseDesc: Creates a confirmed expense immediately • Type is enforced by category
expenses.draftsSectionSubtitle: Edit inline • Confirm creates a real expense
expenses.draftsFromTemplates: Drafts come from Admin → Templates. Create or update templates to generate drafts you can confirm here.
expenses.noExpensesInList: No expenses in this list. Add one with the form above or confirm drafts.
expenses.monthClosedEdit: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to edit expenses.
expenses.monthClosedDelete: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to delete expenses.
expenses.monthClosedConfirmDrafts: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to confirm drafts.
expenses.monthClosedEditDrafts: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to edit drafts.
expenses.deleteExpenseConfirm: Delete this expense? This cannot be undone.
expenses.reviewDraftsTip: Review these drafts, adjust category/description/amount, then click <1>Confirm</1>. Once confirmed, they move to "real expenses".
expenses.confirmCreatesRealNote: Confirm will create a real Expense (and the draft will disappear).
expenses.monthClosedAdd: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to add expenses.
expenses.monthStoredNote: Month is stored as the 1st day of the month (UTC). USD displayed without decimals.

income.title: Income
income.subtitle: Income, extraordinary & taxes — {{year}}
income.intro: Set income per month (nominal or net, e.g. from onboarding), extraordinary income and taxes. Total is used in Budget.
income.budgetNote: Total income = nominal + extraordinary − taxes. This value is shown in Budget.

budgets.title: Budget
budgets.subtitle: Annual plan & actuals (USD base) — {{year}}
budgets.step4Desc: Fill your monthly Other expenses here. Income is set in the Income page. Base expenses come from actuals/drafts.
budgets.step4Tip: Tip: Start with the current month — you can refine later.
budgets.closedMonthsLocked: Closed months are locked • Open months: Income + Other expenses editable • Base expenses come from actuals or drafts
budgets.tipBaseExpenses: Tip: Base expenses = actuals if the month has expenses; otherwise it uses the sum of draft planned expenses (templates). Other expenses is your manual adjustment.

investments.title: Investments
investments.subtitle: Portfolio + Accounts — {{year}}. All values are at the start of each month.
investments.summaryIntro: Net worth and returns by month. Each column is the value at the start of that month.
investments.noMovementsYet: No movements yet. Add deposits or withdrawals in the form above.
investments.step3Title: Step 3 — Set your Accounts and Funds
investments.step3Desc: Add <1>Accounts</1> (bank cash) and/or <2>Funds</2> (investments with return). In each month column, enter the capital at the start of that month.
investments.step3Tip: Tip: To track net worth only, start with Accounts. Funds let you project returns.
investments.monthClosedEditSnapshots: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to edit.
investments.monthClosedAddMovement: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to add movements.
investments.monthClosedEditMovements: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to edit movements.
investments.monthClosedDeleteMovements: This month is closed. Reopen it in Admin to delete movements.
investments.deleteMovementConfirm: Delete this movement? This cannot be undone.
investments.addFundDesc: Fund: investments with target return, e.g. crypto, funds. Account: cash, e.g. bank. Create one, then fill each month column with the value at the start of that month.
investments.goToAddFund: Go to Add fund or account
investments.name: Name
investments.noPortfolioYet: No funds yet. Add one above.
investments.noAccountsYet: No accounts yet. Add one above.
investments.monthlyVariationNote: Monthly variation = net worth at start of next month − start of current month. Real returns = portfolio variation − net flows (USD only).
investments.portfolioTableDesc: Each column is that fund's capital at the start of the month. Edit the number and blur to save.
investments.movementsPortfolioDesc: Deposits and withdrawals made during the month. They affect the real return calculation (USD only).
investments.notesMovements: Deposit = money in. Withdrawal = money out. USD only.
investments.accountsDesc: Each column is the balance at the start of the month. Empty months carry forward the previous value. No yield.

admin.title: Admin
admin.subtitle: Settings & management — {{year}}
admin.accountIntro: Change your password and see the account you're signed in with.
admin.categoriesIntro: Create and edit categories to classify your expenses (fixed and variable).
admin.templatesIntro: Recurring expense templates. They generate drafts you confirm in Expenses.
admin.monthCloseIntro: Closing a month locks its data and freezes next month's values.
admin.displayCurrencyDesc: Totals and summaries will be shown in this currency across the app.
admin.usersDesc: Create, edit, delete users • reset passwords
admin.templatesDesc: Create (or edit) your base templates (e.g. Rent, Utilities). This will generate drafts you can confirm in Expenses.
admin.step1Tip: Tip: Start with 2–5 fixed expenses and 2–5 variable ones.
admin.categoriesDesc: Manage categories used by expenses and templates
admin.tipPasswordBlank: Tip: If password is blank, it won't be changed.
admin.name: Name
admin.templatesNotVisibleDesc: These templates do not generate drafts in Expenses. Click "Add" to show them there.
admin.templateNote: Note: On update, only planned drafts in open months and not confirmed are synced.
admin.step4Muted: 4. Add income in Income, and other expenses in Budgets
admin.templateCreatedInfo: Template created (planned drafts generated for open months of current year).
admin.step1BannerDesc: Step 1 is to review your Categories and Templates, and create your base template.
admin.recentActivityDesc: Latest created users and verification codes. Email send failures are only logged server-side.
admin.categoryHasExpensesError: This category has expenses linked. Remove or reassign those expenses first.
admin.closeMonthPreviewP1: You are closing the month with a real net worth of <1>{{netWorthEndUsd}} USD</1>, having started with <1>{{netWorthStartUsd}} USD</1>, which gives a balance of <1>{{realBalanceUsd}} USD</1> (end − start net worth).
admin.closeMonthPreviewP2: The balance calculated in {{budgetTitle}} based on your income and expenses is <1>{{budgetBalanceUsd}} USD</1>, which differs by <1>{{differenceUsd}} USD</1> from the real balance.
admin.closeMonthPreviewP3: "Other expenses" for the month will be adjusted so it balances. Do you want to proceed?
admin.closeMonthPreviewP3NoAdjust: Congratulations! The balances match. Confirm close?

onboarding.tagline: Order your finances, ground your spending, grow your dreams.
onboarding.step1Sub: Admin → Templates. Define your base monthly template.
onboarding.step2Sub: Expenses → confirm drafts to create real expenses.
onboarding.step3Sub: Investments → add Bank Account and any funds you track.
onboarding.step4Sub: Income → fill monthly income. Budgets → fill "Other expenses".
onboarding.hideForNow: Hide for now (you can reopen it later)
onboarding.wizardWelcomeSub: We'll ask you a few questions to set up your budget template. You can add or change anything later.
onboarding.wizardDisplayCurrencyQuestion: In which currency do you want to see your totals?
onboarding.wizardDisplayCurrencyDesc: Totals and summaries will be shown in this currency across the app. You can change it at any time from the side menu.
onboarding.wizardHousingSub: Select what applies (you can pick more than one):
onboarding.wizardHousingMortgage: I own and pay a mortgage
onboarding.wizardTransportSub: Select all that apply, indicating how much you spend on average per month.
onboarding.wizardRecurrentSub: Which of these do you spend on regularly?
onboarding.wizardIncomeWork: I have fixed income from work
onboarding.wizardDoneSub: We've created your template. Next we'll show you where to add expenses, see your accounts, and your budget.
onboarding.wizardTransportFuelNote: For Car/Motorcycle, the amount is used as your fuel estimate ({{category}}).
onboarding.tourStep0Body:
The expenses you pre-loaded in the onboarding were added to your monthly template.

Here you can edit and confirm expenses for the current month.

To edit the template (add or remove items), go to Admin.
onboarding.tourStep1Body:
If you entered savings in a bank account in the wizard, you'll see it here at the bottom (Account type).

If you added investments (broker, funds), they're pre-loaded too. Here you can view balances, movements, and returns.

In movements you can indicate when you moved funds from accounts to investments in a given month.
onboarding.tourStep2Body:
Your monthly income is pre-loaded if you entered it in the wizard (to edit it, go to Income).

Expense projections are based on the base template and the actual expenses you enter each month.

It also includes investment income if you have any.

In "Other expenses" you can add large planned expenses (trips, car, events) to estimate your balance and projected annual savings.
onboarding.tourStep3Body: Here you'll see a summary of everything you've loaded: monthly expenses, income, savings, and annual projection.
